summary.long: Philemon is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, Unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellow laborer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in thy house:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having heard of thy love and faith which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus and toward all saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the hearts of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, though I might be bold enough in Christ to enjoin thee to do that which is befitting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet for love’s sake rather I beseech thee, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In time past he was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am sending him back. Thou therefore receive him, who is mine own heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would have retained him with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the Gospel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but without thy mind would I do nothing, that thy goodness should not be, as it were, of necessity but willingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him back for ever—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not now as a servant, but more than a servant: as a brother beloved, especially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee aught, put that on mine account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, have written this with mine own hand: I will repay it; albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord; refresh my soul in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But besides prepare me also a lodging, for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow laborers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
